00008 GaussianSampLikelihood::GaussianSampLikelihood(double Mean, double Variance)
00009 {
00010         likelihoodMean = Mean;
00011         likelihoodVariance = Variance;
00012 }

00014 GaussianSampLikelihood::GaussianSampLikelihood(double Mean, double Variance, double (*_transform)(double))
00015 {
00016     likelihoodMean = Mean;
00017     likelihoodVariance = Variance;
00018     transform = _transform;
00019 }

00025 // TODO  we need a variance check to make sure the variance doesn't collapse
00026 
00027 double GaussianSampLikelihood::updateCoefficients(double& K1, double& K2, double Observation, double ModelMean, double ModelVariance) const
00028 {
00029    
00030     
00031         double sigX = sqrt(ModelVariance);
00032         double y = Observation - likelihoodMean;
00033 
00034         // importance sampler mean and deviation
00035         double mq = ModelMean; 
00036         
00037 
00038         // Inflate the prior in the initial population Monte Carlo run
00039         // This is an arbitrary factor.
00040         double sq = 4 * sigX;   
00041         double ev = 0, pM = 0, pV = 0;
00042         
00043         // population monte carlo bit here
00044         for(int iCyc=0; iCyc < SamplingLikelihood::numberCycles; iCyc++)
00045         {
00046                 vec sx = mq + (itpp::randn(SamplingLikelihood::numberSamples) * sq);
00047                 
00048                 vec transH = apply_function( transform, sx);
00049                 
00050                 //      computing weights
00051                 vec importanceWeights = (itpp::pow((sx - ModelMean) / sigX, 2.0) - itpp::pow((sx - mq) / sq, 2.0)) / 2.0;
00052 
00053                 importanceWeights = itpp::exp(-importanceWeights) * sq / sigX;
00054                 
00055                 // multiply the importance weight with likelihood
00056                 importanceWeights = itpp::elem_mult(importanceWeights, exp(-itpp::pow(y - transH, 2.0) / (2.0 * likelihoodVariance)) / sqrt(2.0 * itpp::pi * likelihoodVariance));
00057                 ev = itpp::sum(importanceWeights);
00058                 importanceWeights = importanceWeights / ev;
00059                 
00060                 pM = itpp::sum(itpp::elem_mult(sx, importanceWeights));         
00061                 pV = itpp::sum(itpp::elem_mult(itpp::pow(sx, 2.0), importanceWeights)) - pow(pM, 2.0);
00062 
00063                 //      Update the proposal distribution
00064                 mq = pM;
00065                 sq = sqrt(abs(pV));
00066                 
00067                 if (isnan(sq)) {
00068                     cout << endl;
00069                     cout << "sx = " << sx << endl;
00070                     cout << "transH = " << transH << endl;
00071                     cout << "y = " << y << endl;
00072                     getchar();
00073                 }
00074         }
00075         
00076         //      Sampling
00077         K1 = (pM - ModelMean) / ModelVariance;
00078         K2 = (pV - ModelVariance) / pow(ModelVariance, 2.0);
00079         
00080         return log(ev);
00081         
00082 }
